executive_summary: Homeowners' insurance protects households against property damage from natural causes or theft and liability from inflicting bodily injury or property damage on others. Demand for homeowners' insurance is typically stable regardless of fluctuations in macroeconomic factors. Homeowners' insurance is typically considered a requisite expense for protection against the inherent risks of homeownership. To this end, well over three-quarters of all US households have homeowners' insurance.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Positive Economic Trends Contribute to Revenue Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the past five years, the homeowners' insurance industry has expanded because of rapid increases in housing starts and per capita disposable income.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Industry Profitability Climbs as Operators Cover Claim Costs and Manage Regions With Severe Weather
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Operators managed to increase premiums sufficiently to cover claims costs, keeping the industry profitable.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Investment Conditions Improve Adding to Revenue Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Insurers are long-term, risk-averse investors that increasingly use the income from investments.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising Barriers Put Downward Pressure on Establishments But Employment Jumps
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Rising barriers to entry have resulted in greater stability among operators.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Underlying Factors and Investment Income Will Continue to Improve
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: A jump in housing starts will contribute to increased demand for homeowners' insurance.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Catastrophic Losses and Risk Assessment Technology Will Continue Impacting the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite the difficulty of accurately predicting catastrophic events, continued population growth continues to expose insurers to higher property damage risks.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Profitability and Government Assistance Are Expected to Hike
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As a key determinant of industry profitability, large-scale losses will continue to impact industry performance.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry Expansion Will Result From Growing Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Increased demand for homeowner's insurance will attract new entrants into the homeowners' insurance industry.

industry_definition: This industry includes insurers that underwrite homeowners' insurance policies. Homeowners' insurance protects households against property damage or losses due to catastrophic disasters.
key_trends: Natural disasters will continue to threaten the industry over the next five years.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers aged under 35 represent over one-quarter of revenue.
Consumers aged 55 to 64 are often downsizing their homes.
Consumers aged 65 and older are the second-largest market.
This segment represents the smallest category of owners.
This segment has decreased slightly as a share of industry demand.

products_and_services.product_description: Covers all home damages except for those specifically excluded.
Covers all personal property within the policyholder's home.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Homeowners' insurance is considered a necessary part of homeownership.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeastern region accounts for the largest number of insurance providers.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Insurers are less willing to renew insurance policies in heavily affected areas.

top_companies.company_name: State Farm Mutual Automobile Insurance Co

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Natural disasters lead to large claims costs.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Operators Encounter a Moderate Level of Revenue Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: The need to protect home values is satisfied through homeownership insurance.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Operators Offer Products Through Online Services
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Operators increasingly offer products through online services.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Companies in this industry specialize in homeowners' insurance.
